decision_conditions: Reason : 1 - The development would result in the loss of a family sized unit, thereby failing to comply with the principle of, in particular, policy H11.1 of Merton Local Plan 2024

Reason : 2 - The proposal by reason of substandard layout and lack of demonstration of functionality would fail to provide an acceptable standard of residential accommodation and living space resulting in an unsatisfactory standard of accommodation to the detriment of the amenities of future occupiers of the x2 C3 units. The proposal would therefore be contrary to, in particular, polices H11.1 and D12.3 of the Merton Local Plan 2024 and the National Described Space Standards.

Reason : 3 - The development has failed to provide sufficient secure, integrated, convenient and accessible cycle parking facilities, contrary to policy T16.2 of  Merton's Local Plan 2024 and T5 of the London Plan 2021.

Reason : 4 - In the absence of adequate refuse and recycling storage facilities for the development, the applicant has not demonstrated that the scheme would safeguard the free flow of traffic in the locality to the detriment of highway and pedestrian safety and safeguard the visual amenity  of the area.  The scheme is contrary to, in particular, Policies D4, SI 7 & SI 8 of the London Plan 2021,  Merton Local Plan 2024 policy D12.2, D12.3 and W14.4.
Reason : 5 - The applicant has failed to provide a soft-landscaping scheme or any biodiversity measures, thereby failing to comply the objectives set out in, in particular, G5 of the London Plan 2021

Reason : 6 - In the absence of a satisfactory Air Quality Neutral Statement, the applicant has failed to demonstrate that the development would be at minimum air quality neutral, not worsening local air quality thereby failing to comply with policy SI1 of the London Plan 2021

Reason : 7 - In the absence of a fire safety strategy, the applicant has failed to demonstrate that the development would provide the highest standard of fire safety, thereby failing to comply with policy D12 of the London Plan 2021.

Reason : 7 - In the absence of a fire safety strategy, the applicant has failed to demonstrate that the development would provide the highest standard of fire safety, thereby failing to comply with policy D12 of the London Plan 2021.

Reason : 8 - By reason of the absence of an energy statement (demonstrating that the scheme would achieve a 100% improvement on Part L, Building regulations 2021), absence of  information to demonstrate water usage rates and absence of information relating to ventilation or overheating, the applicant has failed to demonstrate compliance with, in particular, Policies CC2.1, CC2.2, CC2.3, CC2.4 CC2.5 and CC2.6 of Merton's Local Plan 2024 and London Plan policies SI2 and SI4..

Reason : 9 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton  (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:
"	Offering a pre-application advice.
In this instance:
"	The application was not considered to comply with the provisions of the Development Plan and NPPF as submitted, and would have required substantial changes such that a new application would be required. 
"	It is noted that the applicant/agent did not engage in any pre-application discussions.
"	The applicant is advised to seek pre-application advice on any resubmission.
